result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Antonio Santiago #102753 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution Ordered:  Crime Victim Compensation - $5,988.68; L.C. - $224.95; D.N. - $9,600.00; M.H. - $640.00; surcharge - $1,645.36
Defendant is to pay court costs, including the DNA surcharge.
Defendant is to receive AODA programming as deemed necessary.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant is to participate in Cognitive Intervention Group as deemed appropriate.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.
